title: ICE: Index out of bounds: librlibc

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
When compiling librlibc b06bed7 as part of mvdnes/element76:

```
14:03:09-vagrant/vagrant/Desktop/element76 ((138acee...))$ uname -a
Linux vagrant-ubuntu-trusty-64 3.13.0-35-generic #62-Ubuntu SMP Fri Aug 15 01:58:42 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
14:03:29-vagrant/vagrant/Desktop/element76 ((138acee...))$ rustc -v -V
rustc 1.0.0-nightly (ba2f13ef0 2015-02-04 20:03:55 +0000)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: ba2f13ef0667ce90f55ab0f1506bf5ee7b852d96
commit-date: 2015-02-04 20:03:55 +0000
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.0.0-nightly
14:03:33-vagrant/vagrant/Desktop/element76 ((138acee...))$ make
rustc -g -L rustlibdir --out-dir=bin --crate-type=rlib --crate-name=rlibc --target i686-unknown-linux-gnu rlibc/src/lib.rs
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 55 but the index is 55', /home/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-linux/build/src/librustc/lib.rs:1

stack backtrace:
   1:     0x2ac04735bd60 - sys::backtrace::write::h932393543d112c054sy
   2:     0x2ac04737f460 - failure::on_fail::h4947072b7f324f9aVWF
   3:     0x2ac0472e0800 - rt::unwind::begin_unwind_inner::had7a395ab2928a1fsBF
   4:     0x2ac0472e1310 - rt::unwind::begin_unwind_fmt::had7aaeeb99919a22YzF
   5:     0x2ac04737f2c0 - rust_begin_unwind
   6:     0x2ac0473c8e20 - panicking::panic_fmt::ha5c2aa5052803f0ayow
   7:     0x2ac0473d1c80 - panicking::panic_bounds_check::hf63197afd6e4f95eznw
   8:     0x2ac0491b6c80 - middle::lang_items::LanguageItemCollector<'a>::collect_item::hef3b211a375a7115dGC
   9:     0x2ac0491b98d0 - middle::lang_items::collect_language_items::h93a233b2e1baeb083JC
  10:     0x2ac046f2d4e0 - driver::phase_3_run_analysis_passes::hdbd51c532175b9f1pGa
  11:     0x2ac046f13a30 - driver::compile_input::h3abd4b23cefb4912Cba
  12:     0x2ac046fe4f80 - run_compiler::hf6c7680d20cecff97ac
  13:     0x2ac046fe3610 - thunk::F.Invoke<A, R>::invoke::h12458147831130807544
  14:     0x2ac046fe2540 - rt::unwind::try::try_fn::h13767943623378092967
  15:     0x2ac0473eb3b0 - rust_try_inner
  16:     0x2ac0473eb3a0 - rust_try
  17:     0x2ac046fe27f0 - thunk::F.Invoke<A, R>::invoke::h15079797001481760000
  18:     0x2ac04736b950 - sys::thread::thread_start::h426dd27d44093655UCB
  19:     0x2ac04d5690c0 - start_thread
  20:     0x2ac047a19fd9 - __clone
  21:                0x0 - <unknown>

make: *** [bin/librlibc.rlib] Error 101
```

This happened due to compiling using rust libs from an earlier version of the compiler (2-2-2015 I believe), so not something that we should necessarily care about supporting, but ICE are bad nonetheless.
